byline.contributor: Chris Dixon contributed from Hollywood. S.C.
byline.original: By MAGGIE HABERMAN and JONATHAN MARTIN

abstract: Some African-Americans in South Carolina view Republican opposition to Pres Obama selecting successor for Supreme Court Justice Antonin Scalia as yet another attempt to deny legitimacy of first black president; anger and dismay in black community over nomination fight could have impact on presidential election, as top Democrats seek to galvanize black voters, whose increased participation in 2008 and 2012 was crucial for Obama's victories.
lead_paragraph: Some African-Americans saw the move by Republicans to block a Supreme Court nomination as another attempt to deny the legitimacy of the Obama presidency.

headline.main: Blacks See Bias in Delay on a Scalia Successor
headline.print_headline: Blacks See Bias in Delay on a Scalia Successor

snippet: Some African-Americans saw the move by Republicans to block a Supreme Court nomination as another attempt to deny the legitimacy of the Obama presidency.
